H0.text: Wavelength is the part of a sound wave that measures loudness.

H1.text: Magnitude is the part of a sound wave that measures loudness.

H2.text: Amplitude is the part of a sound wave that measures loudness.

H3.text: Frequency is the part of a sound wave that measures loudness.

A4.text: Loudness is the subjective perception of sound pressure.

A5.text: The perception of loudness is related to sound pressure level (SPL), frequency content and duration of a sound.

A7.text: Sound waves are often simplified to a description in terms of sinusoidal plane waves, which are characterized by these generic properties: Frequency, or its inverse, wavelength; Amplitude, sound pressure or Intensity; Speed of sound; Direction.
